page.title: 06BENENDEN WEALD, RIDING.
page.content: For a lesson at Moat House Riding School we exercise our horses by trotting round the school, changing the rein, making circles, doing loop serpentines and lengthening the stride to make the horses alert and listening to us. Our instructor makes us work on our positions by exercises such as putting the reins into one hand, stretching the other hand up into the air and then circling the arm backwards. Sometimes we do a sitting trot after taking our feet out of the stirrups. We also canter, jump and use trotting poles.Sometimes we go outside or with an instructor on a hack into Hemsted Forest. At the end of the lesson we put our horses back in their boxes and untack them.
